verses.verse: “You defiled your sanctuaries By the multitude of your iniquities, By the iniquity of your trading; Therefore I brought fire from your midst; It devoured you, And I turned you to ashes upon the earth In the sight of all who saw you.
All who knew you among the peoples are astonished at you; (Ezek. 26:21) You have become a horror, And shall be no (Ezek. 27:36) more forever.” ’ ”
Proclamation Against Sidon Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
“Son of man, (Ezek. 6:2; 25:2; 29:2) set your face (Gen. 10:15, 19; Is. 23:2, 4, 12; Ezek. 27:8; 32:30) toward Sidon, and prophesy against her,

and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Ex. 14:4, 17; Ezek. 39:13) “Behold, I am against you, O Sidon; I will be glorified in your midst; And (Ps. 9:16) they shall know that I am the LORD, When I execute judgments in her and am (Ezek. 28:25) hallowed in her.
(Ezek. 38:22) For I will send pestilence upon her, And blood in her streets; The wounded shall be judged in her midst By the sword against her on every side; Then they shall know that I am the LORD.

“And there shall no longer be a pricking brier or (Num. 33:55; Josh. 23:13; Is. 55:13; Ezek. 2:6) a painful thorn for the house of Israel from among all who are around them, who (Ezek. 16:57; 25:6, 7) despise them. Then they shall know that I am the Lord GOD.”

Israel’s Future Blessing ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “When I have (Ps. 106:47; Is. 11:12, 13; Jer. 32:37; Ezek. 11:17; 20:41; 34:13; 37:21) gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and am (Ezek. 28:22) hallowed in them in the sight of the Gentiles, then they will dwell in their own land which I gave to My servant Jacob.

And they will (Jer. 23:6; Ezek. 36:28) dwell safely there, (Is. 65:21; Jer. 32:15, 43, 44; Amos 9:13, 14) build houses, and (Jer. 31:5; Amos 9:14) plant vineyards; yes, they will dwell securely, when I execute judgments on all those around them who despise them. Then they shall know that I am the LORD their God.” ’ ”
Proclamation Against Egypt In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
“Son of man, (Ezek. 28:21) set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him, and (Is. 19:1; Jer. 25:19; 46:2, 25; Ezek. 30:1—32:32; Joel 3:19) against all Egypt.

Speak, and say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Jer. 44:30; Ezek. 28:22; 29:10) “Behold, I am against you, O Pharaoh king of Egypt, O great (Ps. 74:13, 14; Is. 37:1; 51:9; Ezek. 32:2) monster who lies in the midst of his rivers, (Ezek. 28:2) Who has said, ‘My River is my own; I have made it for myself.’

But (2 Kin. 19:28; Is. 37:29; Ezek. 38:4) I will put hooks in your jaws, And cause the fish of your rivers to stick to your scales; I will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, And all the fish in your rivers will stick to your scales.

I will leave you in the wilderness, You and all the fish of your rivers; You shall fall on the open (Ezek. 32:4-6) field; (Jer. 8:2; 16:4; 25:33) You shall not be picked up or gathered. (Jer. 7:33; 34:20; Ezek. 39:4) I have given you as food To the beasts of the field And to the birds of the heavens.
“Then all the inhabitants of Egypt Shall know that I am the LORD, Because they have been a (2 Kin. 18:21; Is. 36:6; Ezek. 17:15) staff of reed to the house of Israel.
(Jer. 37:5, 7, 11; Ezek. 17:17) When they took hold of you with the hand, You broke and tore all their shoulders; When they leaned on you, You broke and made all their backs quiver.”
‘Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Surely I will bring (Jer. 46:13; Ezek. 14:17; 32:11-13) a sword upon you and cut off from you man and beast.
And the land of Egypt shall become (Ezek. 30:7, 8) desolate and waste; then they will know that I am the LORD, because he said, ‘The River is mine, and I have made it.’

Indeed, therefore, I am against you and against your rivers, (Ezek. 30:12) and I will make the land of Egypt utterly waste and desolate, (Ezek. 30:6) from Migdol to Syene, as far as the border of Ethiopia.
(Jer. 43:11, 12; 46:19; Ezek. 32:13) Neither foot of man shall pass through it nor foot of beast pass through it, and it shall be uninhabited forty years.

(Jer. 25:15-19; 27:6-11; Ezek. 30:7, 26) I will make the land of Egypt desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and among the cities that are laid waste, her cities shall be desolate forty years; and I will (Jer. 46:19; Ezek. 30:23, 26) scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.”
